TopicTitle: Are We Jumbled? Challenge (Difficulty depends on mods)

Articles.Content:
Try to get to each moon in the Jool system by using maximum 3 rockets/spaceplanes.

Rules:

  1. Use all types of engine you have eg. [LFO, Jet, Nuclear, SRB, Ion, Monopropellant OMS, Multimodal] 
  2. If you have mods that add new types of engines like Cryogenic Engines, use them in your craft.
  3. Mods Allowed
  4. Gravity Assists, Aerobraking and Aerocapture allowed.
  5. Parachutes, Heat Shields and Lander Legs allowed (except any Comfortable Landing Parts)
  6. Once done, upload kerbalx craft files with one video to prove that your craft works and must feature up to 3 craft.

 ~~~~Engines not required~~~~

  • Reaction Wheel
  • Motorised Wheel
  • Helicopter propeller (KSP Breaking ground expansion)
  • Deep Space Explorer engines (example FFT and MEV Heavy Industries)

~~~~Engine blacklist~~~~

  • Ultra efficient engines (Isp at least 100k)
  • Warp drives of any kind
  • Even though it is not an engine, AFK harvesters are not allowed.

 

Good Luck! 

 

Edited November 28, 2022 by The Dark Player
Added (Deep Space Explorer engines) on not required list as these engines are big and will cause a lot of burden on people. (However Reusable SSTO can carry these engines.)
Kraken drive is not allowed as it is a form of infinite propulsion

This is EXTREMELY weird, with the mod requirements, since you allow FFT, but ban super efficient engines, so pick one, pick your own difficulty IMO
FFT has some engines that are below 100k Isp. If you could use them, I will be happy. However, FFT is not needed.
Do you allow ultra-efficient engines to run im lower efficiency modes?
